conclusion: Particle A reaches peak speed 2v₀ at t = t₀ and decelerates linearly to zero speed at t = 3t₀.
Particle B reaches speed v₀ at t = 4t₀ and decelerates linearly to zero speed at t = 6t₀.
Acceleration magnitude is calculated as change in speed divided by time taken for that change.
For particle A, Δv = 2v₀ and Δt = 2t₀, so |a_A| = (2v₀)/(2t₀) = v₀/t₀.
For particle B, Δv = v₀ and Δt = 2t₀, so |a_B| = (v₀)/(2t₀).
The magnitude of particle A’s deceleration is twice that of particle B; the ratio is 2 : 1.
